Thank you very much for your answers !

The problem with Unity3D's Mono =
as I understand it, is that is not the "main Mono", it is its own modified =
version (from 2.6), and as Unity3D is not thread-safe I think my problems c=
omes with that.
They removes some features of "Main Mono".

By the way, I'm=
 a little afraid to modify some deep AI Framework like NEAT, but as you tel=
l me I can strip the ParrallelOptions Dependencies and find a workaround, I=
'll give it a try.
I was thinking it is a mandatory dependencies as it invo=
lve a very different mechanic (And my Csharp is brand new^^).

For now, I j=
ust obtain mono.exe to crash T.T, and that just with an empty class (I will=
 try to reproduce the XorExperiment class with the stripping).
The crash di=
sappear when I remove the inheritance of IGuiNeatExperiment... pretty bad s=
tart !

namespace SharpNeat.Domains.Xor{
public class MyXorExperiment :  Sh=
arpNeat.Domains.IGuiNeatExperiment{}
}


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin=
 Green <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> What version of Mono are you =
using? My understanding is that parallel
> extensions were added to version=
 2.6:
> 
>     http://www.mono-project.com/Release_Notes_Mono_2.6
> 
> "Thi=
s release includes some components of the ParallelFx framework
> that were =
developed as part of Google Summer Of Code 2008 & 2009. More
> precisely, i=
t contains the Task Parallel Library and Data Structures
> For Coordination=
."
> [...]
> "To use this code you have to manually enable the .NET 4 profi=
le using
> the --with-profile4=3Dyes switch at configure stage."
> 
> So po=
tentially you just need to enable the .Net 4 profile.
> 
> Wesley's option =
is a good fall-back option if that doesn't work.
> Either way you should be=
 able to get the latest SharpNEAT working on
> Mono, I believe I tested it =
on mono using the preliminary parallel
> extensions code they released back=
 in 2008.
> 
> Regards,
> 
> Colin.
>
